channel.title: Lettier Blog RSS Feed
channel.copyright: Copyright David Lettier (C) 2016. All rights reserved.

item.title: TF-IDF VSM vs BM25 with Vue.js
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Vue.js, we build a JavaScript based search engine capable of using tf-idf VSM and Okapi BM25 simultaneously.

item.title: Data Mining Hacker News: Front vs Back
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell, R, Python, SQLite, and Elasticsearch, we data mine Hacker News front page stories and their back page counterparts for patterns.

item.title: Making Movie Monad
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell's Blaze, Fay, and Clay, we build an Electron desktop video player application.

item.title: Matthews Correlation Coefficient
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using a fictitious scenario, we explore the Matthews Correlation Coefficient quality measure of binary classification.

item.title: Building a Haskell Web API
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using the Snap framework, we build a web server API that creates, reads, updates, and deletes web bookmarks.

item.title: Haskell to JavaScript
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Reflex-FRP, we generate a stylized push button interface widget written in Haskell and playable in a web browser.

item.title: k-Nearest Neighbors from Scratch
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using JavaScript, we implement the k-Nearest Neighbors algorithm from the bottom up.

item.title: Data Visualization with Haskell: NYC Public Urination
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell, we collect, process, and chart NYC 3-1-1 urinating in public complaints.

item.title: Make a HTML5 Canvas Game with Physics
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using FuntionalJS, PhysicsJS, PubSubJS, and EaselJS, we develop a HTML5 canvas game called Dubul Rubul.

item.title: Breadth-First Search in Haskell
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell, we implement the breadth-first search algorithm.

item.title: Let's make a NTP Client in C
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using C, we build a Network Time Protocol client capable of getting the current time from a remote NTP server.

item.title: K-Means from Scratch
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using vanilla JavaScript, we build an interactive k-means clustering application from scratch and test the clusters using the silhouette coefficient metric.

item.title: Fibonacci, LCM and GCD in Haskell
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell, we implement the Fibonacci sequence, Least Common Multiple (LCM), and the Greatest Common Divisor (GCD).

item.title: Max Subarray in Haskell
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using Haskell, we implement the linear time algorithm that solves the max subarray problem.

item.title: Birthday Condolences, Greeting Card Classifier
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using scikit-learn, we build a binary classifier model capable of classifying greeting cards as either birthday or condolences.

item.title: Reelin' and ROCin', Receiver Operating Characteristic
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using a fictitious scenario, we explore the Receiver Operating Characteristic metric.

item.title: Triforce Overload, Sierpinski Pyramids
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Using only the WebGL, we implement an explorable environment containing two 3D Sierpinski tetrahedrons lit by per fragment lighting.

item.title: Text Mining in R: Death Row Prior Occupations
item.dc:creator: David Lettier
item.description: Analyzing the Texas Department of Criminal Justice death row inmate data, we text mine death row inmates' prior occupations.
